amendment.description: Amendment sought to prohibit the State Department from imposing restrictions on any intellectual property law or policy of any country in Africa or Asia, including Israel, that is designed to make pharmaceuticals more affordable, if such law or policy complies with the Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, no. 15, printed in Part B, H.Rept. 106-235 to prohibit the State Department from imposing restrictions on any intellectual property law or policy of any country in Africa or Asia, including Israel, that is designed to make pharmaceuticals more affordable, if the law or policy complies with the Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Sanders amendment (A009) Failed by recorded vote: 117 - 307 (Roll no. 322).
